laboratory_examinations.findings: White blood cell count at the upper limit of normal with lymphopenia and normocytic anemia.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat laboratory testing showed new leukocytosis.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Slight elevation in aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine transaminase (ALT), and alkaline phosphatase (ALP) levels.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat laboratory testing showed more pronounced elevations in AST, ALT, and ALP.
Repeat laboratory testing showed markedly elevated ESR.
Repeat laboratory testing showed markedly elevated CRP.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Originally non-reactive with titer measured at < 1:64.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Convalescent serology showed a greater than four-fold increase in the Ehrlichia IgG titer (1:256) 28 days after the acute sample collection.
